required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Paricalcitol Over Vessel Wall
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Paricalcitol Over Vessel Wall: Pleiotropic Analogues Vitamin D Effects

lead_sponsor.agency: Effice Servicios Para la Investigacion S.L.

clinical_study.source: Effice Servicios Para la Investigacion S.L.

brief_summary.textblock: To provide evidence based prospectives of the potential benefit effects of paricalcitol, an analog of vitamin D, over the prevention / retardation of the progression of neoangiogenesis (vessels), atherosclerosis and vascular calcification.

detailed_description.textblock: Providing prospective results based on evidence of potential beneficial effects of paricalcitol, an analogue of vitamin D in the prevention / delay of progression of neoangiogenesis (vessels), atherosclerosis and vascular calcification.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Protocol showed to be inappropriate for the evaluation of the selected patients

primary_outcome.measure: Prevention on vessels progression based on paricalcitol intake.
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed for the duration of whole study, an expected average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Providing prospective results based on evidence of potential beneficial effects of paricalcitol, an analogue of vitamin D in the prevention / delay of progression of neoangiogenesis (vessels), atherosclerosis and vascular calcification.

arm_group.description: Patient will take one pill of paricalcitol a day.
Patient allocated to this arm will only take his/her habitual treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged between 50 and 75 years.
- Chronic kidney disease stage 5 D or 4-5 No D as calculated glomerular filtration rate (MDRD).
- Concentration of intact parathyroid hormone (iPTH): 150-400 pg/ml.
- Plasma concentrations of 25 (OH) vitamin D <30 ng/ml.
- Without vitamin D supplementation for 3 months before the study.
- Serum P> 3.8 mg / dl.
- Serum Ca> 9.8 mg / dl.
- No history of cardiovascular events (angina or myocardial infarction, stroke, peripheral arterial disease).
- No exclusion criteria for the use of contrast.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergic reaction to sulfur hexafluoride.
- Recent unstable cardiac symptoms.
- Patients with recent coronary intervention (<7 days)
- Patients with class III and IV heart failure or severe arrhythmias.
- Severe pulmonary hypertension.

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital Universitario Arnau de Vilanova de Lleida.
